channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Thai Court to Rule on Paetongtarn Shinawatra’s Future in Office
item.description: Paetongtarn Shinawatra is facing a legal challenge that’s seen as an important test of her powerful family’s standing with Thailand’s old guard.

item.title: Rodion Shchedrin, Composer Who Captured Russia’s Soul, Dies at 92
item.description: Mr. Shchedrin drew on Russian literature for stage works and was an eager experimenter, inspired by folk tales, religious mysticism and melodrama.

item.title: A Tariff Loophole on Cheap Imports Has Closed. How Will It Affect Shoppers?
item.description: The end of the “de minimis” exemption — which allowed packages less than $800 to enter the U.S. tariff-free — is leading to confusion.

item.title: Current mortgage rates report for Aug. 29, 2025: Rates flicker slightly up after dip
item.description: Compare average mortgage rates on different types of home loans so you can pick the best mortgage for your needs as you house shop.

item.title: ANZ staff face pay cuts if office attendance markers aren’t met

item.title: When Mailing a Letter to the U.S. Becomes a Global Headache
item.description: A driver’s license renewal, a box of specialty candy, even early Christmas presents — all are caught up in the confusion caused by a new Trump adminis...

item.title: Appeals Court Declines to Block Trump From Freezing Foreign Aid

item.title: 2 Weeks After Trump Talks, Russia Bombards Kyiv, Killing at Least 23
item.description: The strikes, which hit a five-story apartment building, a shopping mall and buildings used by European governments, were the largest on the Ukrainian ...

item.title: Students Call for More Protests in Indonesia After Fatal Clash With Police
item.description: Rising unemployment and inflation have driven the protests in Jakarta, the capital. The police responded with force on Thursday, killing a 21-year-old...

item.title: ‘We Are All Shocked’: Warming Waters Bring a Stinging Sea Slug to Spain’s Coasts
item.description: The blue dragons, which pack a ferocious sting, have led to several beach closures. Experts say it’s a worrying sign of the warming of the Mediterrane...

item.title: New home inventory is at its highest level since just before the housing market collapse that led to the Great Recession, but that doesn’t mean it’s the same market
item.description: Since roughly 2022, ResiClub co-founder Lance Lambert told Fortune, "the national power dynamic has slowly been shifting from sellers to buyers."

item.title: Nvidia’s China-based rival posts 4,300% revenue jump as chipmaker’s earnings reported no H20 chip sales to the country
item.description: The sales surge reflects Beijing’s push for local players amid geopolitical tensions.

item.title: Over half of professionals think AI trainings feel like a second job, LinkedIn survey finds
